Convert linked-read data to unaligned BAM for NCBI subission
When submitting sequences to NCBI, they reformat the read headers, which means any useful information in the read headers disappears. This applies to haplotagging, TELLseq, and stLFR FASTQ

If you didn't already know, the BAM format is quite flexible and contains all the fields one would already use in FASTQ format. BAM (or SAM) files can also have unaligned records in them, meaning you can quite easily convert a paired-end set of FASTQ
The reverse of this process is conspicuously named from-ncbi.
